author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...BARRY NEARING THE EASTERN GULF COAST OF MEXICO... ...HEAVY RAINS AND FLASH FLOODING ANTICIPATED OVER PARTS OF EASTERN MEXICO FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS...
summary: ...BARRY NEARING THE EASTERN GULF COAST OF MEXICO... ...HEAVY RAINS AND FLASH FLOODING ANTICIPATED OVER PARTS OF EASTERN MEXICO FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS... As of 4:00 PM CDT Sun Jun 29 the center of Barry was located near 21.2, -96.9 with movement NW at 9 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1006 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 45 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...BARRY NEARING THE EASTERN GULF COAST OF MEXICO... ...HEAVY RAINS AND FLASH FLOODING ANTICIPATED OVER PARTS OF EASTERN MEXICO FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS... As of 4:00 PM CDT Sun Jun 29 the center of Barry was located near 21.2, -96.9 with movement NW at 9 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1006 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 45 mph.

title: Summary for Tropical Storm Barry (AT2/AL022025)
